Summary: From the beds, renovations of some of the rooms, and staff (including the owners, The Patels, and the housekeeping staff), this is a great property in the Costa Mesa/Newport Beach. Good price and location, and one of the best properties in the Orange County area.  -William

Summary Heading: Fair price for the location, but not a 5 star resort!
Summary: At the time I paid a cheap price for the location and my room was actually pretty roomy and clean and fair for the price. It was on the first floor. The parking does lack, try not to give up your spot if its a good spot just a heads up. Otherwise it was clean when I went there
Room tip: First floor room on the east side was actually pretty roomy, spacious and clean

Summary: This place should be avoided, because they clearly do not care for their customers.  When weather kept my flight from getting me to Southern California for my Uncle's Memorial Service and I had to cancel, they kept my money.  They were told of the issues and refused to issue a single penny of refund.  The owners are obviously cheap miserly non-compassionate people and I would avoid this place.

Had a horrible time was basically accused of having people come in and out of my room all night when I was there alone with my son we went out to go get taco Bell when we came back the office was calling me accusing me of having multiple people in and out of the room running drugs apparently that's what I felt like anyway I will never go there again I don't recommend it to anybody I feel like the hotel staff and given some guy trying to get into my room my name I don't know anybody who lives there or just visiting someone in the hospital but this young guy that I've never seen before new my name sounds suspicious to me

Convenient to I-55, rooms need a lot of work. Hotel needs renovations. Breakfast was honey buns, cold cereal,  hot coffee. Pool is hidden in corner. I stayed because it was close to what I needed to get to for my stay.

Never underestimate this hotel! The staff; Including Yesenia, Paul and Mike were not only friendly and welcoming, but this out question are 💯% committed to You, the customer. Paul went above and beyond with his great spirit and willingness to help. Yesenia greeted us with a smile, a print out to the nearest Subway and a suggestion for amazing food. She is the sweetest hotel hostess. Mike is the manager, and without hesitation offered us great insight about our coming day trip to Newport Beach. The room-awesome! Vaulted ceilings- comfortable beds-Windows-A/C that works- clean clean clean-Housekeeping staff is friendly and helpful. Highly recommended and will be our Hotel if Choice every visit. Thank you Days Inn by Wyndham-Costa Mesa/Newport Beach. PS coffee is hot and

Big rooms and nice staff.  Breakfast could have a little more of a selection but overall the place is great. Love that the vending machine isn’t over priced ! Everything is a dollar:) I’ll be coming back again.

I have a 3 year old.  I requested a crib a month before checking in.  When I checked in I found out they'd given their one crib to someone else who checked in the previous day.  Betty who worked at the front desk seemed to delight in our predicament.  She said you can pay to have a pull out bed which wouldn't be safe for our 3 year old (and of course no comp offered in any way).  We had to book another room because expecting our daughter to sleep on the floor.  Of course they refused to offer a refund, families beware.  We will not book another Days Inn hotel of any kind.  Breakfast is trash here (they explained it at checkin, we did not spend the night)

I had a great time staying at the Days In Costa Mesa. All of the staff was amazing but I really want to give kudos to Maria she was so nice and accommodating. She got us in early and just a really nice gal. Her care for customer service sets the bar high!  Thanks again...

Great Stay would go back again room was clean spacious and super quiet area. the front desk was great and you only have a 25 dollar incidental deposit. The breakfast was lesa than desirable but none the less it held the kids over til we got a real breakfast would definitely go back again

Wonderful! Everything from friendly faces to clean room.  We had a couple small problems with the key and the tv; there was someone in the office that fixed them immediately. We even had our own air conditioner to adjust the temperature.

This was very, very disappointing. Not at all typical of Wyndham properties. Worst hotel we have ever stayed at and we travel a lot. Carpet old and dirty. Furniture old and chairs stained. Leather desk chair totally worn out. Continental breakfast not at all desirable.  Toaster broken. Would never ever stay there again. We were told we would have a non-smoking room when we made the reservation.  Not the case. Disgusting.

close to beach,  pool was unheated.  Breakfast real basic but free,  we stayed two night.  able to check in early which was a plus,  People were pretty nice.  Not much more to say.  I have to use 200 characters,

The service was fine. The room was very well organized. The location was excellent because it was near the triangle and other restaurants. The part that was best was the rooms environment. The room also had a lot of furniture that was excellent.

The room was gross. Carpet had food and other stuff ground into it, I had to wear shoes the whole time. I asked the desk if housekeeping could clean it but it didn't look any better.  There were roaches in the bathroom the second night. The breakfast is cereal, juices boxes, and a few pastries. The whole property reeked of smoke. I had a hard time sleeping because I was so worried something was going to crawl on me.  Furniture was very old. Never again

Pray nobody is staying for longer than a night or your chiropractor will love you.  In fact, on behalf of chiro's everywhere, I encourage you to stay here. If you're a chiropractor in the Destin,  FL area, I need you after sleeping here.

Great location for a business trip, clean hotel, quick trip to Newport, well worth the price. Good service and extremely pleasant staff. Looking forward to staying there again. Close to the beach and other sites the owner, Mike Patel was extremely helpful. Steve

This place is old and worn out. The owners need to seriously consider a complete remodel of this hotel or just forget about business. The walls and ceilings have water spots. The room has a musty smell. The whole motif is outdated. It feels like I traveled back to the 1970's.

Summary Heading: Great location, property needs an update.
Summary: Great location.  Everything was 20’minutes away by car.  Room needed updating.  Smelled like old smoke in a non-smoking room.  The sheets smelled old, sweaty and musty.  On the plus side the staff was very friendly and accommodating.

I often stay here and it is usually decent enough and a good value for the price.  However this time around, though they have made some upgrades my room smelled like urine.  Other than that the hotel was fine.  I will give them another chance but hope that this has been remedied.  I will say that the breakfast is good and the rest of the hotel was fine.  Large rooms, comfortable bed, plenty of parking.

Summary Heading: Place to crash after Time Nightclub
Summary: I booked a 2 room suite with 2 queens bed for a great price, very comfortable rooms came with fridge, microwave, and a recliner chair also! 10 minute walk to Time Nightclub so was perfect after a Saturday night out! Clean with a normal bathroom with nice big towels.

Betty was great. Quick and easy service.  Clean and quiet rooms. Bed are comfortable. The fridge and microwave were clean. TV worked well with many channels. We were extremely happy with value and price

I stayed here while attending a local conference. I chose this because I get Reward Points and it was much less expensive than the hotel where the conference was held. The room was clean, though it did have a strong, but not unbearable, cleaning solution odor. Water pressure in the shower was low, internet was slow, breakfast was basically cereal and pastries. Still, I got clean, did what little I needed to do online, and got something to eat. So for the price, fair enough. I did find the folks at the front desk to be friendly, helpful, and professional. I REALLY appreciated that. If I find myself in Costa Mesa again I have no problem staying here.

The room stunk so did the prices . They were not willing to give me a reimbursement. I booked the hotel so my family could visit me but things came up and they weren't able to come. I called asking if I could get a reimbursement and they didn't want to work with me.

I needed assistance with my reservation.  Yesenia went above and beyond in assisting me with my reservation on 09/26/2018.  She provided excellent customer service.  She was very kind, conscientious, and professional.

Couldn’t stay at this place more than 2 hours. Very loud, smoking at none smoking area, people where wasging there clothes and hanging it in the hall way. When I asked the service member, I have been told Its Sunday and its okay.

Room had a smell of urine. The “breakfast” is a joke!  If there is any coffee left, even at 7 am, you get a small paper cup to use. The breakfast is store bought honey buns, danish and you can get toast and cartons of juice. Maybe the management should have put a little more thought into the service and have a nice coffee bar instead of having granite in the bathroom. Your staff at the front counter also needs training to provide better service. We won’t be back.

Fast easy check in. Friendly staff working front desk. Nice big clean room, clean carpeting. Clean bedding and towels. Basic cable tv with selection of channels. Fridge, AC, and micro worked. Plenty of lighting. Good location and area. Plenty of restaurants and shopping near by. Definitely need a car though to get around. Great for a 2 day stay.   Cons: Deposit for room was a bit much. Parking was cramped  Weak WiFi connection

I read a number of low rated reviews on this hotel and I have to say that I have no idea where those people stayed. They certainly didn't stay here. There was nothing to complain about.  Nothing.  The room was clean, the shower was great. The bed was big and comfy. The room was well serviced. The cost was affordable.  The location was convenient. Other reviewers complained about drunks and vagrants.  I didn't see them.  The breakfast wasn't gourmet, but they had fresh raisin bread for toasting.  Can't beat that.  The staff was attentive. The parking was adequate.  I arrived back one night after 10 and there was still a spot for my car. I'd certainly stay here again.

Horrible smell when you walk into the room. We had a non smoking room and bathroom had a strong cigarette smell. There were stains on the walls next to the bathroom and in the bathroom walls. The floors were so dirty it was disgusting to walk barefoot.

I rented a non-smoking room, when I entered the room it stunk like stale smoke and the furniture was visibly filthy.  I asked the office staff to cancel, and I was told I would be charged regardless of the condition of the room.  Currently I am still trying to have the charges reversed.  Do not patronise this hotel.

I did not expect to get such excellent and helpful service At a days inn to be honest...  But the hospitality that Maggie & Yesenia showed me was amazing!  They were so warm kind and inviting, they made me feel right at home! Super friendly and sweet staff, quick service,  clean and Affordable accommodations in a great location. They  honestly made me feel like family and I must definitely will be staying again very soon! :)

Summary Heading: Furniture was old, stained and ripped. The toilet seat was...
Summary: Furniture was old, stained and ripped. The toilet seat was cracked and peeling. Inside was awful!

First I made wrong day reservation (I travel a lot for work) they charged me for a no show but came in the next week and would not give me credit (my fault). Then the room had stains all over the carpet and the toilet would run every 10 minutes. Tried to ignore the people in the room below me with there tv loud enough that I could not get to sleep. Called the front desk to no avail...Had to go to the front desk and tell them to inform the other people to turn their tv down...as i said going down hill...I would advise to look at other options as I will from here on

Summary Heading: We had noisy neighbors at 1am two of the 4 nights. The...
Summary: We had noisy neighbors at 1am two of the 4 nights. The staff were great, beakfast was horrible. Packaged danishes and cereal. No protein at all, and only powdered cream for the coffee. There was mold in the windowsills in the bathroom and bedroom and on the ceiling in the bedroom. Otherwise it was great!
The property is old. The location is good and the freeway access is incredible. The rooms are clean but the carpets are old.

I love this simple, quality place.  The staff was friendly, the room was nice, the shower was wonderful with a rare tall shower head for CA.  Great location right near the highway.  I would definitely stay here any time I am in town.

The hotel is in a great location. The staff was absolutely wonderful. I was there for a week and the staff accommodated me for all my needs.  The location is central to Newport Beach and there is plenty to do within walking distance.  There are many restaurants close by.  I definitely recommend this hotel.

Summary Heading: You Get What You Pay for Sort Of
Summary: Not too impressed. First room the A/C Unit was broken. We were given a fan until we got a new room a day later. Additionally the WiFi was awful in both rooms. The first room you only got a connection if you were holding your device up against the window. As for breakfast, what a joke. As for the “continental breakfast”, it should be renamed to “gas station breakfast”. Coffee, orange juice, cereal and packaged pastries. The place was clean and beds comfortable. But bring your own tissue and toilet paper. Tissue is one ply rough that’ll take your skin off and toilet paper was soft but shredded instantly. I’ve stayed at quite a few lower priced establishments but this one simply was not good.
THIS hotel is rundown,  in dire need of refurbishing . It's dirty,  and we were greeted by the neighborhood hooker, and a pan handler.

Summary Heading: the worst breakfast, even they did not have hot water. you...
Summary: the worst breakfast, even they did not have hot water.  you can find better places in cotsa mesa with the same price or even cheaper.

Small outdated property with a small parking lot. I was given a remodeled room which was ok in size but still rather outdated. Tv is too small for the room. But they do have a good channel line up. Bathroom is small and could use new fixtures. I was on the top floor so I didn't have to worry about hearing people walking above me. The bed wasn't bad at all. Actually rather comfy and seemed newer. Could use new curtains. HVAC unit was inefficient and noisy. Did have plenty of outlets so that was a bonus. Currently they are doing exterior remodeling and there is some noise and dust but other then that it's not a bad place to stay at all.

Summary Heading: I was there for work so I got a cheap room for awhile
Summary: Cons:   Alot of things in the room did not work or were broke in other ways.  Many of the staff were difficult to deal with Alot of drug abusers on the streets at night...not violent types, just sad.  Pros:  If you have an issue or need to do something, check with Maggie. She was awesome Unlike alot of places in the area, their coffee was pretty good [I take it black so I just get coffee flavored coffee] It was very close to a grocery store, gas station, Japanese restaurant, Irish sports pub and laundry mat. When you are doing long term stay those types of things are important. Lastly, this is the first place in the two star range where the maids cleaned everyday.

Summary Heading: Good quality, low-cost, but beware of noise and cigarette smell
Summary: Overall I was very pleased with days inn costa mesa. There was free breakfast every morning and free wifi 24/7 in the rooms. The beds were comfortable and the rooms were clean. Fresh linens every day! My only complaints are the noise at night time and the smell of cigarettes and cannabis smoke in our bathroom. Even though we requested and received a non-smoking room, the bathroom still smells like smoke! Luckily we were able to open the window, turn on the fan, close the door and the smell was not an issue. The staff here is very friendly and the swimming pool is very refreshing. Thanks so much for making us feel welcome!

We were on the ground floor.  The people directly above us came to their room after 10 PM.  At that time they were stomping (walking heavy) across the floor.  At 1 AM they started yelling at each other and continued until 3 AM.  Complained the next day and the next night they were quieter but still walked heavy.
The room had no air flow and had a terrible smell. The bed was very hard, dull lighting and pixel lines through the tv. Very uncomfortable stay

Summary Heading: I have never seen a Days Inn in such ill repair before. The carpets were disgusting, holes through out, black stains,
Summary: I had the most horrible stay. The room smelled of smoke and mildew. The carpets were black and had burn holes through out. Chairs were stained and wore out. I had to buy a blanket to sleep on as I didn’t trust that the sheets were clean. Easy freeway access was the only good thing about hotel. Staff were slobs and dressed like homeless people!!

Days Inn at Costa Mesa is a functional property, and VFM. Neat and clean, the staff is friendly. Parking is free, breakfast is frugal. Not may eating places nearby, some super markets are at a walking distance. Good for a short stay.

Summary Heading: Very outdated cheaper place to stay

Door had to be kicked to open because of it being unalligned and painted multiple times. We never opened the curtains because the window sills were atrocious.  Hair dryer didn't work, room phone didn't work. Used the coffee maker once, left the coffee in the pot- for 2 days the housemaids didn't notice or replace the used coffee. Came to us on our 2nd to last night to tell us they were going to steam clean the carpets so we had to have everything off the floor. We stayed 9 nights in a king room which hadn't been stayed in for a while. Why did carpets HAVE to be cleaned while we were still in

The lock for the door was broken, the blanket had cigarette burns in it and the ceiling was so thin it sounded as if there was a giant in the room above us. Strangely the bathroom had a very nice granite shower and countertop. Not in a nice part of town, we had a man follow us around the parking lot trying to sell us headphones and then cursing at us and following us back to our room. This is the cheapest hotel I have ever been to. Spend the extra $20-$40 a night and go anywhere else.
