Upon arrival I was notified that there wasn’t a kind bed available only two queens.. however the nice lady who assisted upgraded us to a suite no extra charge. Honestly it was the best stay I have ever had at a hotel. I never leave reviews but this was a stand out experience.

Summary Heading: Its truly a great hotel with great seervice.
Summary: I liked the service firat of all because Maggie was so kind and friendly towards me. The room was very nice and cozy. Access to hot showers, tv, air conditioner, healthy breakfasts and drinks. Maggie was very generous with the food over there. Its a very high quality inn if you'd ask me.

Horrible experience we had a bad experience and I am handicapped.  I requested a first-floor room... on the first day I got a first-floor room but in the evening I seen little Roach is coming out and during the day big ones coming out .  I immediately called management and they move me to a second-floor room which it was extremely hard for me to get up and down the stairs for the rest of my today's days stay!! ;(

This lodge served our need for a one-night stay before catching the ferry to Catalina early the next day.  Even though it was not in the heart of Newport Beach shops and restaurants, it was convenient to stores and a few restaurants so that we didn't need to get into our car once we parked.  Only complaint is that we could hear heavy walking in the room above us at all hours of the night, keeping some of us awake.

Husband waited over an hour to check with our son. Staff was rude!!! Once checked in to dirty motel.  When asked to speak with a manager were told no manger was on site- when suddenly one showed up.    Will never stay here again.
The hotel room was large and nice. The hotel has no breakfast area, so a minimal continental breakfast was served in the office.

Summary Heading: Continental Breakfast is A table in the lobby with 4...
Summary: Continental Breakfast is A table in the lobby with 4 chairs. Your Hotel Info and Services needs to be updated because you DO NOT have laundry facility for guest to use.

Summary Heading: Room was a nice size.  It had a old smell.  Beds were hard...
Summary: Room was a nice size.  It had a old smell.  Beds were hard.  Pool was green on spots.  Staff was great. Air conditioner worked great.

Summary Heading: Green Pool and not helpful management.
Summary: This place was not much help when it came to solving problems. Management was M.I.A. And to top.it all off, the pool was green.

Summary Heading: All in all this was an average stay. I liked the...
Summary: All in all this was an average stay. I liked the complimentary breakfast however the internet  highly dissapointed me. The door in my room was hung crooked so light would enter the room via the door. X

This motel is in a great location within 15 minutes of a few beaches and lots of shops, which was my main reason for staying here. The motel is older, but the rooms are clean and have been updated and contain everything you could need. The staff was friendly and provided me with a nice hair dryer when the one on my vanity wall wasn't working. The wifi didn't work too well, but overall for the low price, I had a pleasant stay.

We stayed at this Days Inn 3 nights over a weekend.  It was clean, comfortable, and for the most part, quiet.  Our room had been updated and everything worked.  The gals at the front desk were nice and accommodating.  The only drawback, and the reason I only gave 4 stars, is that the bathroom door was very loud and was in dire need of some WD40.  We told the front desk about it twice, and again on our last day, so hope it got taken care of. The continental breakfast was adequate and is what is usually expected of a continental breakfast.  It's located in the lobby, so it's a little cramped while several people are trying to pour coffee or juice or butter their toast.  We would stay there again.

The front desk clerk was friendly, but other than that it's a tired place in need of updates.  Couldn't get rid of the odd smell in the room.  The wifi is not secure.  The "breakfast" is pitiful - all carbs.  The AC was loud and only blasted freezing air despite wherever the thermostat was set.  Overpriced for what you get.

All of the workers and staff were very polite and helpful but the place needs a face lift.  Outside is old, rooms need paint and new rugs.  Room smelled (possibly from AC or rug).  TV automatically goes off after one hour which was exceptionally annoying.  Continental breakfast is not good, limited choices of prepackaged goods.  For the price, I expected more.

Summary Heading: I guess management dose not check the rooms from a guest...
Summary: I guess management dose not check the rooms from a guest view dose the meaning heads in the beds mean anything? Look up clean and paint the ceiling cob webs dirt and ? Blood stain?

Summary Heading: Absolutely terrible place. We were promised "breakfast...
Summary: Absolutely terrible place. We were promised "breakfast" what a joke..oatmeal in a package, stale bread for toast, cold/old coffee danishes in a package. Room was outdated. For the price charged I could have stayed in Hilton

Stayed here to visit Legoland(an hour away)and to go to the beach.  Stains on carpet and bedspread, someones t shirt left on the floor.  Otherwise clean and comfortable.  Breakfast is minimal but staff at desk was very friendly and helpful.

This place was not what they said they were. The front desk was not welcoming and did not want to help at all. Our rooms smelled like weed. When I asked the front desk for one more bottle of shampoo they didn't want to give me another. They had attitude and it was overall an awful experience.

Very nice hotel for the price and really close to Newport Beach. The room was very clean and really spacious. I would recommend it 100%. The only issue I had was the wifi was a little bit slow. But other than that everything else was perfect.

This is a very average quality motel but very economical for the area if booked several weeks in advance. The room was neat and clean including the restroom. The restroom had been stocked with basic toiletries. Lots of parking spaces and we never had a problem except for one night when it was packed but the night manager helped us find a slot.   While making the booking, we were told by the manager on duty that every room had safe deposit boxes. Unfortunately, on arriving we were informed by the hotel owner that none of his rooms had any secure boxes and someone must have given me incorrect information.  There were a few issues which are listed here: 1. The exhaust fan in the restroom would not work. As a result when taking a shower the mirror would get fogged up. There was a

I just want to start with saying that I'm not usually into leaving good or bad reviews but, I just had to this time. This location really stood out to me because they had great customer service not just the front desk it was all around great from the great housekeeping service to the friendly  management, they accommodated my needs. I truly had an amazing get away with my husband. I totally recommend staying here we  will definitely be returning for a weekend get away very soon.
we had booked a fishing trip out of Newport Beach,CA for 5/27 and had to get a place to stay in nearby so Costa Mesa,CA came up and worked perfectly

The price is very reasonable considering the prime location and multiple competitors on the same street.  But the old adage,"You get what you pay for" is so true.  The building is tired looking inside and out.

So I normally don't expect much from my hotels I just ask for them to be somewhat clean for them to offer breakfast if they say they have breakfast and that's pretty much it. So this hotel first started by double charging me for the room so I had to deal with my bank to remove the charge because they denied it, also we were looking forward to getting in the pool and it was closed they seem to have had it closed for a long time now but they lied and said just for the weekend. I also went in for breakfast and they only had honeybuns cereal boxes with no milk , I expect more from Days inn honestly I know it's not a good hotel but still other days inns that I've stayed at are at least OK this one wasn't even close to OK

When I walked into the room the cigarette smell was so strong and yes I know it was a smoking room but that smell knocked you out. Went to place water in fridge and found it unplugged. No outlet where fridge was so I had to unplug the alarm clock. Turned on lamp between beds and there was no light bulb. The lamp above the first bed had no bulb no cover. The light over the 2nd bed had a bulb but wouldn't come on. Took the bulb from there and placed in lamp between beds and found that it was also unplugged, and there was no outlets to be found. Had to pull one of the beds out to get to a plug. When we did this the headboard fell from the wall where it was screwed in. Oh well!!! The pillows were horrible, flat and had no stuffing whatsoever in them. The room just felt dirty. And
Everything is clean. Customer service is on point. I would recommend it to anyone that needs a good place to stay.

The building was old and hasn't been updated. The window screens had holes and window were open when I arrived. The carpet on the stairs is old, torn, and stained. This place is not as nice as other Wyndam hotels which I have stayed.

We stayed in a smoking room which was the only room they had, it wasn't expensive but before we even opened the door, the trash can was in front of the door, the window screen was torn in half and there was a crack in the window glass. When we went inside, the first 4 seconds we killed a spider. The mini fridge was unplugged and in the middle of the room. Tried to lock the door but the lock thats above the door handle the one you lift over the hook idk (I can't think of the name lol) was torn off the door and hanging on the wall. All the drawers were open, the carpet had a blood stain, the toilet wasn't flushed, & the bath tub wasn't drained. I tried to access the Internet but the network name wasn't even on the list. Luckily it was one night and it was a last minute thing. It
One of the rooms that I was going to stay in had a bunch of roaches in the bathroom and under the bed sheets and mattress

Summary Heading: Terrible - DO NOT Stay Here If You Value Sleep!!!!
Summary: I had the misfortune to stay at this motel on 15th April. As it was Easter weekend, and we had decided to travel to Newport Beach at the last minute, many of the other hotels were very expensive so we opted for Days Inn...what a mistake.   Whilst the room was ok it smelt musty, however, we felt we could live with this for one night. When we returned to the motel at 11pm we were kept awake until 5am by drink and drug fueled 'neighbors' who caused a violent racket throughout the night. Nobody was on hand to help resolve the matter and we ended up with 2 hours sleep once they had thankfully passed out.   I appreciate that some things are unfortunate but to have no assistance in times like this (when the situation is potentially getting violent) is poor and staying at a Days Inn is

My daughter had a concert she had tickets to and we live kind of far to drive back and forth so I used my member points to book a room at the days inn. Check-in was easy room was clean and comfy and we were close to the venue and plenty of food places too. Breakfast had a lot to choose from so that was good. Staff was great.

Good location for the Costa Mesa area. Parking can get very tight. Our room could do with some freshening. The AC/Heating is under the Bathroom sink area and very difficult to reach. Not in the usual front window location. Easy chair had damaged the wall behind it. Bed was clean and comfortable.
Booked Days Inn Costa Mesa through Booking.com in December. After we got to Days Inn in Costa Mesa in April the price was different. Have to handle this issue since Days Inn couldn't take care of it.
This hotel was close to the beach, great location within driven distance to lots of fun locations. The staff was great and helpful. Room was perfect for a sisters weekend getaway .
Holes in the walls covered by wall paper taped to it. Not that cleanest bathrooms. Customer service was great.

Summary Heading: The top bed sheet was brownish in color, so thin it had tiny holes in it and grass on it, dirty.
Summary: The reception was very nice and helpful when I was checking in, the manager even walked me to my room because there was some shady looking guy on a bike hanging out in front of the hotel, this was not the hotels fault. The carpeting was sticky and the top sheet was thin and seemed dirty. It was so late when I checked in that I was too tired to change rooms. I chose to sleep on top of the bottom sheet only and had a hard time sleeping because of the dirty sheets and carpeting. Had I not been so tired, I would have changed rooms and/or had the hotel change the sheets.

The hotel was easy to find and the girl that checked us in was very polite and nice..the room was very spacious the pillows weren't that great but it did the job..the water was hot and had good pressure!! Our frig didn't work so that sucks and there is no jacuzzi which is a super bummer would have given a better rating if there was! So overall descent place to come and lay your head down when your day is over.

Summary Heading: Overall good stay. Just don't take your shoes off
Summary: The room had some damage and the TV was crud, but the walls were thick enough to block sound and everything was cleanish. Room reeked of smoke though and the carpet was filthy. But you get what you pay for and I got a great deal of this room. Slept amazing though. Wherever they get their beds and pillows is amazing.

I stayed there for 7 days,  the carpet was wet, furniture had moisture on it, the owners had pulled the plugs including the fridge as a result the stink was horrible! Doesn't have a safe lock box, no microwave and the worst thing of all, the linen stink too! The button for bedside lamp was broken. Room 119 has no WiFi signal, the connection dropped every five minutes and I advised if that happens, just restart your laptop,  which never helped.
I was so uncomfortable with the way the owner was treating employees and had a very bad experience

The front desk lady was helpful.  Overall it was the second cheapest place near Newport B. I guess you get what you pay for. Bathroom door was off hinges. Would do it again. Reminds me of the room in No Country For Old Men.

Summary Heading: Take your money even after you show up to personally cancel your reservation
Summary: My wife and I went to see the hotel ahead of time to make sure that it was what we needed for our family and the front desk agent who was nice enough to show us the room but said that they very seldom rented out the suites and that the manager Mike Patel would have to decide. So we thought it would be best if we just cancel our reservation until we could confirm that a suite would be available at the Employee Rate that I had booked. I was under the impression that the female rep was taking care of cancelling the reservation. But I was charged anyway. I then explained that to another female manager and told her that she could check the cameras and see that my wife and I were there a week before, and that I was also a Wydham Employee. However, my refund has still not been

Summary Heading: Days Inn Orange County - Newport News
Summary: I would not recommend this motel. The staff was friendly and efficient. The rooms are old and need to be updated.  The breakfast was a complete waste of time. Overall I would rate this Inn one step above a dump. The staff is the only thing it has going for it. There are newer / nicer hotels in the area for the same price.
The rooms were dirty looking, wall paper coming off walls, bathroom door wouldn't close was not put on properly, bed was super comfortable and free wifi was essential for my work.

The Service was very prompt and professional here. The room was dimly lit even with all the lamps on that was an issue for me. The carpeting felt damp and sort of tacky with bare feet and I feared it was not clean so wore shoes or socks on feet. Bed was extremely comfy. The window in the bathroom was hard to lock and a security risk-- therefore.  Heater unit worked great and was very quiet at night.

Large quiet room with comfortable bed.  Facilities are old and room needed repairs.  Hole in wall and nightstand drawer front was broken.  Should not advertise breakfast as it was just small boxes of cereal and convenience store sweet rolls.  Free parking and internet was a bonus.

Please don't check in into this hotel . When i go to the room the smell so bad.. the airconditioning diean't work, and dont have any cold water , i used hot water for everything. The internet can't connect to my ipad and they didn't give me the password until i called the front desk.. this is very awful days inn. Dont come here. Waste of money and its expensive ..

I usually stay at the Days Inn.  They put me in a disabled room with 4 or 5 chairs in the bathroom.  Piled on top of each other.  I usually go up for a day or two to relax.  The first lady who checked me in was great, the second day the front desk lady wasn't so nice.  No smile, not much help, didn't seem to know what she was doing.  My second night there, the room upstairs was so noisy all night, I didn't sleep much. Anyway, I was glad to get home, and, would probably go again but hope I would get the first lady as front desk.  My daughter works for Wyndem hotels and got the reservation for me.  My husband is in hospice and sometimes I need a rest.  Thanks, Barbara

The staff are very wonderful there at Days inn I especially apprieciate Joselin and Josenia for being such welcoming and accommodating hostesses also the team of house keeping I only caught Gloria's name but those women are fantastic so keep up the good work Days inn Costa Mesa I know it's my favorite home away from home                                Scincerly, Alex Rose
The hotel was very clean and comfortable. The room style was unique with high ceilings and such. Needs a little TLC in places, but other than that, it was a good stay.

The staff is very friendly, helpful and professional. The rooms are very clean. This was about the eighth time I stayed at this Days Inn.  And it was the first time I did not feel safe.  On three occasions some one knocked on our door after 9:30pm. Also there were all sorts of people coming on the property. On one occasion an employee came out to kid them off of the property. The guest next to us was cleaning large truck tires in his room and working on his motorcycle. This was the worse experience I have ever had at this Days Inn. I am a platinum member of the Wyndhan rewards.

Summary Heading: Great hotel, probably best in costa mesa
Summary: Arrived at hotel around 12:30pm and the room was ready even though check inn is at 3pm. Great customer service, very friendly staff and big rooms. Way better then most others in the area

The staff at Days Inn Costa Mesa are top notch!  The rooms are dated but ok.  But, our last stay was upsetting when I went to use the complimentary bottle of lotion and it was already used!  Then when I went to fill the water in the coffee pot and found a hair in it.  Also the shower grout had mold growing on it.  The rooms are reasonably priced but our most recent stay will be our last.
It was a slow boogie day for me but an even much more Booler week staying here really talk mane
bed spread, blanket, curtains all had burns in them bed was aweful bathroom not finished smelled bad

Summary Heading: A very nice accommodation close to the beach.
Summary: Nicely kept old brick building. Very solid and quiet. Excellent and very accommodating employees. Very clean. Furniture is somewhat old, but serves it's purpose well and ads some character to the place. Had a great 5 nights. They were very welcoming to Me my Wife and our service dog. No problems what so ever.

Trouble checking in, in one room the bed were very low to the floor, one of room keys didn't work and the staff wouldn't give me another key, breakfast was poor, had raisin bread and bagels but no toaster, then they put ash trays right outside of room door so when you leave your room, you have to walk thought the smoke of people sitting on the bench, need to put smoking rooms on the back side away from non-smoker rooms

So we just needed a room for the night, we chose the "upgraded room" . I don't know exactly what that means, but this is what we found. We were on the 2nd floor, no elevator (not a big deal), smelled someone smoking pot everytime we opened the door. The light switch right inside the door turned on this "light" over the front window that looked like a round clock and was red! No light given at all. The upgraded features included a refrigerator and microwave that were not plugged in upon our arrival. The refrigerator was not only not plugged in but the shelves inside were not inserted properly so the door would not close, my husband had to fix it and set it up. Took a long time to cool the refrigerator up. The microwave was also not plugged in, and when we did plug it in and try

Summary Heading: Comfortable / Very friendly and accommodating staff.
Summary: Clean and quiet despite being right on a main street.  Room was clean smelled fresh and had everything you would need for a one - turned into two day stay; coffee maker, microwave,  nice size refrigerator,  of course blow dryer, iron and board.  They had HBO movies on demand for free and a light breakfast consisting of hot and cold cereals, milk, danish,  bagels cream cheese, coffee and tea.  There was a very clean pool, no hot tub.   Overall a very peasant stay.  Shout out to Greg who found me a room, when I made my reservation a day too early and to Mike and his wife for accommodating my stay an extra night on a whim.  All very gracious!

Very disappointed with this hotel. We just tried to check in for our reservation and the room had a broken tv, broker telephone and the refrigerator was unplugged so some reason when we walked in. We asked to be moved to a different room with functioning amenities but management refused our request saying they had to charge us more to move. I work at Caesars Palace in Las Vegas. I understand how hotel operate. Totally bogus on management's part to try to charge us for an "upgrade" just to get a room with basic, operating features. The manager, Manny Patel, argued with us and was extremely rude and hard to deal with. We ended up leaving, and to top it off, she charged us for the full stay! Needless to say I will be disputing the charge. Please don't stay here. For slightly more

We stayed one night and it was a very nice room, big, clean, everything was in great shape. Convenient, right off of the freeway, lots of food and shopping nearby. The price was ridiculously low. Very good place to stay.

This was a simple family getaway for labor Day weekend and overall it was a wonderful trip.  LaCosta resort was exquisite in services and accommodations - but our room and bathroom was not cleaned well at all...had cereal on the carpet all around the bed, a large red jelly? sticky spot on the carpet near the waste basket and more garbage on the floor in the bathroom.  It was never taken care of by housekeeping any day we were there!?  But the facility is an amazing place and I would go back there for sure again!
Rooms tired and beat up, holes in walls. Electrical plugs not screwed into wall. Had to wait two hours for room to be ready.

Rooms are very old, very dirty, blanket had cigarettes holes on them, we asked for a baby cot they gave us an old broken and dirty thing good for the junkyard, we had to send it back. The aircon box was changed in our room during our stay without letting us know, as a result our room was left dirty by the handymen, the carpet was left wet and when we asked for the room to be cleaned we were treated like we were being difficult. We have been in California for 18 days sleeping in cheap Inns like this one, out of all the places this is definitely the worse. Don't go unless you cannot find anywhere else (there are plenty of other Motels all around this one).
It was good. It was not great. The TV did not work. It came on but we couldn't change the channel.

We spend one month in this hotel. This hotel is very clean and the room is great and near to newport beach and balboa beach All the stuff are friendly . Me and my wife would like to thank Mr, Mike Patal and all the stuff . Thank you and we will come next year. Wahba,Nadia

Was going to a concert at the Orange County Fair/Pacific Amphitheater and did not want to drive home.  Check in time was 3:00.  I arrived at 1, and they had a room available for me.  The person at the front desk was very nice and handled check in quite efficiently.  The room was a little warm, so I turned on the AC and it didn't take long at all to cool down. The room itself seemed to be a bit larger than standard motel rooms.  I only spent the one night there, so can't really brag on too much.  However, I was disappointed in the continental breakfast, as I am with most continental breakfasts offered at hotels/motels.  I grabbed a cup of coffee, and went to Norm's restaurant and had a great breakfast.

Summary Heading: DAYS INN YOU Have got to GET BETTER!
Summary: I spent $150.00 for a old run down room, with a  broken refrigerator,  that did not work its cord was unplugged and sitting inside the refrigerator. THE Bed was old and sunken in the Middle. My experience was horrible. This was a weekend gift for my Son and he accepted with disappointment, Thank you.

We landed a nice room with high ceiling wood beams and comfortable beds. The pillows could use an upgrade. Pleasant staff and low key environment. Pretty quiet for being right next to Highway 55. The continental breakfast is a low point. You'd be better off grabbing food at Norm's Restaurant, a 4 minute drive.
Room carpet filthy.  Walked barefoot and Feet wet black. When I informed staff and management, I felt they blew me off.  They made a feeble attempt to clean but didn't happen

We were not advised that one of two rooms was for smoking when I needed non-smoking rooms.  In addition, had to pay extra for a non-smoking when I had already paid and had a confirmation for 2 non smoking rooms.

Summary Heading: Fairly Priced in an Over Priced Area
Summary: If you need a room in the pricey O.C. that is centrally located between John Wayne Airport and the beach but doesn't charge an arm and a leg, this your place!  The rooms aren't fancy, the continental breakfast is nothing fancy either, but you aren't going to pay exorbitant prices either.  Tip:  This property is extremely close to the 0.C. Fairgrounds and it can be difficult to get a room if a big event is there at that time.  So, book early!

We were pleasantly surprised by the cleanliness and roominess of our accommodations at this motel.  The staff was friendly and accommodating, and very prompt when we needed some help with the refrigerator.  The room seemed "homey":  sheets weren't starched but soft; and a comfy lazy boy chair to relax in.  The only drawback was access to the HVAC system, which was close to the floor.  The included breakfast was minimal but sufficient.  The room rate was one of the lowest in this area.

I had already been to 4 other Motels in the area. it was late. 3 am.this was due to having an emergency to stay in a motel. i had plenty of currency but not the proper debit card that all the others now want. New policy. No one ever told me such a thing. i arrived here. Mike and Greg assited me accepted my cash and vola Room till 1230pm. I thank you Days Inn. your the best.
Staff were very nice and professional but the hotel needs updating.  Wall paper pealing off walls, electrical plugs loose, carpet/curtains/bedding outdated.

Stayed for a night since we were in the area for a beach visit. Upgraded room because I mistakenly reserved a smoking room (my fault). Cons: Room was musty and carpet kinda squishy. Decor is severely outdated. Bed was okay. Noticed wallpaper warping in spots and door handle to bedroom was missing. Bathroom door stuck and lock didn't work. Pros: room was big, pool was refreshing, bathroom was updated and nice. Breakfast was quick and easy. Price and location are excellent between supermarket and an Irish pub. Don't think I could stay more than one night at a time though.

We chose the hotel because our first choice was fully booked, and we wanted the location.  The room was clean, but quite dated.  The fan in the bathroom didn't work, and the window wouldn't open.  We had to crawl under a counter to adjust the air conditioner.  The staff was friendly and attentive.  Breakfast was only packaged foods - nothing fresh.  It was okay for one night.
A convient nice place. Close to the beach. Great for a short stay. The carpet does need to be cleaned. I was in 123 no bed bugs in that room.

I have been staying at this location for over 3 years when I come to town.....approximately 6 times a month!  I have had good service and clean rooms....however....they have hired a few new people recently and they have absolutely NO customer service and do NOT conduct themselves in a business manner.  First off, when I am coming to town....I haved always called in and spoke with either the owners wife or their main office girl......they always hold a room for me.  I am a AAA member and should be offered these rates.....time to time I was not.  Secondly......when I call in with these new employees......they never remember my name....are rude on the phone.....and several times....Ive called and been hung up on without them even saying hello.  Thirdly, when a room is held for

Summary Heading: Terrible,  booked non-smoking, was given a smoking room...
Summary: Terrible,  booked non-smoking, was given a smoking room. Air conditioning not working and one of the lights is out. They eventually changed to another smoking room and asked that we check out the next morning instead of the 4 nights booked as the new room has been booked for the weekend. We even managed it for a night, we couldn't have stayed.longer. We asked for air freshener, the one they gave smelt like insecticide, even worse. I can go on and on, please add a little more money and go for a much better hotel.

The hotel is a bit old and the room had an odor. Clientele was bad. Comatose women laying on stairs and very frightening fight occurred in the room next door between man and woman.  Could hear possibly furniture being thrown around.

Summary Heading: Depressing, Disappointing, and NOT Handicap Accessible
Summary: When making the reservation, we specifically asked for a handicap accessible room.  There were mystery stains on the mirrors, sitting chair, and walls.  The 'art' looked like a second grade student's coloring book page.  The furniture was old and falling apart.  No walk in shower (standard on handicap accessible rooms) and the structure itself wasn't very sturdy. -- we heard every movement our upstairs 'neighbor' made all night long.  The TVs were at least functional and in decent shape (although really small).  Throughout the stay we kept reminding ourselves that we were saving money and it was only for one night.  Next time, we'll spend a little more and stay at a place that is less depressing and actually handicap accessible.

Me and my family enjoyed our stay at the Days Inn, the room was nice and big. The customer service at the front desk was available and assisted in getting my Wi Fi device to work. The amenities of the room, were also fine. The only drawback is that beds need to upgraded to pillow top mattress.

Summary Heading: Cheap Stay for first nights in USA
Summary: The room was basic but comfortable. You get what you pay for the price was low, wall had started crumbling behind the armchair and needed a lick of paint but otherwise okay. Great for one or two night stays if your passing through but not for longer stays.

Customer service was great the rooms were not anything from the Hilton's but they were good enough for one night. My husband and I were only there for one night and the beds were good and the bathroom was clean and the TV worked great. no complaints and no noise or anything we liked it.

The personnel was very helpful and nice.    The room was supposed to be a disabled room, however, it was not disabled.  Disabled rooms have walk in showers (this room had a bathtub with handicap bench available to use.)  The bench was too heavy for me to install, and the bathtub was too high for me to step over.  The bed was so high I needed help to get in it.  After I was in the bed was comfortable, but getting in was very difficult.  I'm sure this room was just thrown together to look disabled, but was definitely not disabled.  I will not stay at this Day's Inn again.

Summary Heading: Great sized rooms, a large and comfortable bed and great insulation from road noise.
Summary: I slept well and enjoyed the living experience. The location was close to aajor grocery store too. The staff were courteous and knowledgeable.

We asked for  non-smoking rooms and  as soon as we walk into the room the smell was very strong and we got  very bad headaches.  We asked the manager to switch rooms and he said there weren't any others available.  We asked for our money back to find a different room for the following four nights and they wouldn't refund any of the money as we paid in full before arrival. It was hard to enjoy our vacation with a headache every morning.  I feel our whole trip was ruined because we stayed at Days Inn Costa Mesa. Before we left, we tried to change our reservation and Trip Advisor would not refund our money as they said it was not their policy to refund due to any changes.  Our rooms were over $800. and paid well in advance, we tried to change our reservation and they said we could
Room reeked of smoke,weed and musty. Wallpaper falling off wall and access panel off the wall. Just a dump
we enjoyed our stay very much- the rooms were clean- the staff was professional,friendly and helpful- I plan to stay there again

The hotel was easy to find and convenient. The personnel was courteous and helpful.  I was disappointed in that I was hoping for two queen size beds but they offered a rollout which worked out.  I thought the breakfast was very limited. So don't count on it!
The staff were very friendly.  The only thing I would suggest relates to the complimentary breakfast.  Please add some fruit.

Summary Heading: My room smelled like smoke.  They sent housekeeping over...
Summary: My room smelled like smoke.  They sent housekeeping over and walked thru with a can of spray.  In future, I would expect a different room.  I was already sick w a sinus infection and this made me feel worse.  The people above me were running back n forth aND dropping heaving things on the floor.  I did not call the office since it stop about 1130pm

While the room was very affordable, I was disappointed with the cleanliness of the bathroom and with the issue of no smoke detector in the room.  My husband mentioned this twice to staff during our stay - the response was "we are aware of this".  This situation should have been addressed immediately as it is a safety concern/violation.  The room had peeling wall paper on the walls and large areas of paint missing/chipped on a door and door frame.  We wondered if the room was in the process of being renovated, and they rented out the room anyway.
The room smelled extremely musty. Bed linens were aged. The carpet needed cleaning. Very happy to leave and have fresh air. Front desk staff was nice.

The people at this hotel were so nice!!  They let us check in a little early and then they called once we were in the room to double check that we had everything that we needed and to make sure the room was cleaned to our satisfaction.

Cleaning chemicals were like a cloud in the room. Made me feel ill. Staff was nice. Seemed old and in desperate need of updates. Free "breakfast" was coffee and cereal bars. I think it was 2 star on Hotwire  but I would only give it one.

This was the worst hotel stay I have had.  We had to plunge the toilet several times.  The bedside lamps didn't work and seemed to be falling apart.  The pillows were awful. The next door neighbor opened his door and blasted music at 6:30 AM!  There was no way to tell what temperature the heater was set at. The window in the bathroom seemed to have mildew on it.  We could hardly wait to leave!!  I feel we are entitled to a refund of a portion of our room rate.  I will never stay at a Days Inn again.

Ive have been staying here for that last few years when I come to town.  The service is very good!  The rooms are pretty clean.....with the acception of that old school motel odor....its overall a good place to stay!  Keeping it clean is my biggest thing....clean carpets, floors, bathroom and sheets....overall...pretty good.

Summary Heading: Non-Smoking Rooms Smell Like Smoking Rooms
Summary: Even the non-smoking rooms smell like ashtrays.The windows should be cleaned, the mold removed.  This place desperately needs new bed spreads: torn, cigarette burns…  Need to ban smokers from smoking on the property.

The Hotel is close to many restaurants, shops and to the highway.  Is not what I expect from the Chain, it needs lots of work and renovation.  Smelly carpet, old fashioned rooms and lots of burning cigarettes holes on the bed-sheets. Little bit pricey for what I expect. Simple breakfast.Had lots of problem to hook to the internet, either it is slow or not working at all. Service was good and maid was very helpful to come and clean.

Summary Heading: Expedia Trouble and UNWANTED SMOKING room
Summary: This is a great place I stay here once a month or so.  I have had a really bad experience last time on checkin to find that Expedia had given me a Smoking room and i really need NO SMOKING.  The hotel staff was trying to change it but it has been really hard.  I just found again I'm booked SMoking when I wanted No Smoking for my next trip. I will only book directly with the hotel after this. Diane

Summary Heading: Okay on the Major Things, Substandard on the Details
Summary: This hotel is about what I expected for the price; it's got a good location, some things have been improved, and a lot of details are third-rate.  The good things are the TV with a lot of channels, including HBO, a clean bathroom that has a granite surround for the tub and a granite countertop, a decently comfortable bed, and the room is large.  Thee is also a microwave and a refrigerator.  The substandard things include a missing molding around the door, a hole in the hollow-core bathroom door, a torn bathroom window screen, and an old heater-a/c unit that was quite noisy.  In addition, I had no confidence in the cleanliness of the carpet; it felt grimy on the bare feet.  So, between the positives and the negatives, I would say it's an average place, like the engineer who has

This is our second stay (3 yrs  ago) at this inn - very convenient to the Beaches and UC Irvine.  Don't think they have done a thing in the last 3 years - a little paint wouldn't hurt, but it's cosmetic and not really health-related (ie, not dirty), so it's OK - location makes up for it.

The location and price for our visit to Newport Beach really fulfilled my expectations, especially with the lower Internet advanced pricing.  The staff were very helpful, friendly and available.  My only wish was for a bit more variety with the breakfast. The motel was older, but that didn't take away anything from the comfort, cleanliness, and large space in the room.  It was extremely convenient for being close to the airport, surrounding businesses, and our main destination for the trip.

we are from Arizona and come to California at least 4 times a year and stay at different hotels all the time. This hotel was by far one of our worst experiences ever. It was not clean, the bed comforters looked like they were 20 years old and had never been washed, the carpet looked old and dirty and finally, the whole place smelled like weed! Our neighbors were smoking in their room and left the windows open and we could clearly smell what they were doing. We did not say anything because it was already 9pm when we checked in and my 3 kids were already asleep. Our neighbors were also pretty sketchy looking and didn't know if they would do anything to us if we told on them for smoking weed. Also, the continental breakfast was pathetic. Needless to say it was not a good experience

Now pretty much a regular at this venue.  The parking is tight, but manageable.  The staff is always courteous.  I had the best internet reception yet, the stay. I guess the closer to the office,  the better the reception.  The rooms are clean and amenities are in line with the class of lodging.  Great proximity to Newport Beach, the ocean and Hoag.

Summary Heading: Avenue of the arts NP BEACH
Summary: It was truly amazing from the time we pulled in, we had about 12 rooms rented for our wedding at Newport Beach . The staff went above and beyond every single person !! Love this place and we will be back !!

This property is located at the end of the Newport/ Costa Mesa Fwy.  It is walking distance to grocery stores , entertainment and eating places.  The rooms are clean and bright and the staff is friendly and professional.  I have stayed here twice.  I highly recommend requesting an upstairs unit.  The vaulted ceilings allow for a more spacious feeling.  The rooms are quiet and set up with the basics that you would expect.  The only negative is the inconsistent wireless service; but that is a problem with most motels.  Will stay here again.  Convenient and clean.

Summary Heading: A great price, in a convenient location and very nicely renovated rooms
Summary: I was a little worried reading some of the reviews but I always give my honest, fair opinion. The hotel in located right off the 55 a few minutes south of the 405 and 10 minutes north of Newport beach. The upstairs rooms seem bigger with slightly higher ceilings. Our room was recently renovated with new sink, toilet, tun and counters. There is a desk with captain chair, table with 2 chairs, small fridge and microwave. The room didn't smell at all and although there were a few cosmetic issues I would say the rooms get high marks (I peeked in a few open doors). The free breakfast is skimpy with cereal, danish, juices, tea and coffee. But if you are on a budget this hotel gets very high marks,
The bed spreads had holes in them. What we paid for the two nights you could buy new pillow. The food in vending machin was stale. The overall room was dirty.

I stayed at Days Inn for one night with my friend and there was a couple fighting all night next door. It sounded extremely violent and we were scared to our bones. Even after the police had been called and left again, the two started over again. The concierge, however, did nothing and even pretended he did not notice anything unusual until he accidentally let slip that there had been "an officer" at the Motel. I would never go back again. I have never felt more uncomfortable and scared in my life. We left with the first rays of sunlight because there was no way we were going to get any sleep. Others did the same. Although I know that it is not the Motel's fault that there were people fighting, they should have made them leave the Motel immediately.
Bedbugs in my room. I called the next day to report / complain. I'm still awaiting the followup call I was promised.

Summary Heading: nice clean room, updated with plenty of counter space for...
Summary: nice clean room, updated with plenty of counter space for the bathroom, also had a microwave.  We did enjoy our stay and will return.

Summary Heading: I especially liked the staff at the front desk, the...
Summary: I especially liked the staff at the front desk, the housekeeping staff and the easy access to your WiFi.  Thank you for a very nice stay at your Costa Mesa property at a very reasonable price.

My colleague and I had the displeasure of staying at this hotel. Upon walking in the room we were hit by the stench of cigarettes, but this was the least of the problems. The bed sheets looked like they had been in use since the 70s and were covered in holes, as were the cushions on the bed (see photos). The toilet seat was in a worse condition than a public toilet, the curtains were barely hanging on and the bathroom window had fallen off! I could go on, but to summarise the room was in a disgraceful condition. Aside from the awful room, the front of house staff seemed friendly, but don't expect a continental breakfast unless your definition of this is a few cheap cakes and terrible coffee.   Unfortunately there were no other rooms for us to move to and our room was

Summary Heading: Gave Room away with out phone call
Summary: This property is not well run.  Called for late arrival and was assured room would be available. Whe we arrived to check in, was told credit card cancelled.  Associate did not call to explain problem, simply cancelled reservation.  Reservation was made months in advance and credit card co. reissued card with new # and was an oversight but associate should have notified when whe nthe late arrival was requested hour s before it was cancelled.  NO more Wyndham for me.

Reasonable rates, but rooms are very dated. Everything in the room needs to be replaced and updated. Bed was uncomfortable and pillows were in need of replacement. Wyndham needs to set a standard for the hotels they advertise.  I probably will not stay here again.

I highly recommend Days inn at newport beach Costa Mesa, very good service at front desk and the beds were very comfortable, kids enjoyed the pool and we had no problems with parking even at late night, two thumbs up!
Carpet was gross. Bathroom needed remodeling. Paint was peeling 4 layers deep. parking was a hassle.

My 4 year old niece found blood on the pillow sham. Not even 5 minutes after arrival. There was bugs in the coffee pot. The carpet felt like we was walking on soggy sticky floors. Wore shoes. A good note the staff was excellent.

i have stayed her probably a dozen times now.  its clean, comfortable, and has a very nice pool.  the location is very good.   this hotel offers great value for the money.  tip - head SOUTH and pick up the bike path about a half mile away.

Over all I'd rate our stay B. It was in Newport and the parking was tight. Plus the ice machine was out. On the plus side the room was spacious,clean,welcoming. The staff was friendly and helpful. Yes l would stay there again.

This place is awful. Jackie at the front desk had a bad attitude. Had an issue with the remote and went to replace it she was on a date.  Another issue was the noise after 10 pm. I called the front desk and they promised to take care of it.  Called 2 more times and then I told them that I was going to call the police, I guess that was a threat. I told them that I worked for DHS so I welcomed the police.  This experience was just awful.

Summary Heading: Location was great - easy access to all the best beaches...
Summary: Location was great - easy access to all the best beaches.  Leslie at the front desk is the sweetest - very kind and helpful, she gave great recommendations of places to visit.  Room was fine - not a luxury, but very comfy bed and pretty clean.  Great stay for the money!

Hotel is very well located. Rooms are old, but large and comfy. Free wifi + free parking + free breakfast make this budget hotel a GREAT DEAL.  Staff is friendly, walking distance to supermarket, and dinner options. 5 minutes drive to the beach!!!   We got this hotel as an express deal on Priceline and it was a great surprise! Stayed 4  days and we are happy with our experience.

We stayed for one night over the 4th of July weekend. Our room was ready on time, the staff was friendly and helpful, the room was big and clean and the bed was comfortable. In the minus column, we had light bulbs that needed changing and we wished the cable had more channels.

Bad smell from cleaners in room. This hotel/motel needs serious upgrading. You can see outside through the weather stripping around the air conditioner. Refrigerator was not balanced or plugged in; door dragged on floor. Over all look is old and tired.

Stayed at the Costa Mesa, CA facility for one night. Room was clean enough but the bed was very uncomfortable. Could use some maintenance work and replace the bed covers. Cost and distance to my final destination were the main reasons for my choice.

The room was very clean and the desk staff were friendly and accommodating. I had been assigned a smoking room because that was all that was available. But she remembered my request and was later able to change it to non smoking. The bed was comfortable, but bedcover was tattered and torn. The continental breakfast consisted of packaged pastries, coffee, milk, cold cereal and juice.
Mike Patel, the manager was a terrific host. H e made my stay at the inn very comfortable and enjoyable. The rooms were older, but clean.

The ratings reflect more of the total experience we had this trip. I need to mention we've stayed at this Motel before and had a better experience the last time. This time the other customers were a bit rough and confrontational  and not who I would like to be around (being my husband almost got into a fight with a guy who got into his face and yelled at my son for no good reason and that is probably because the area where this Motel is located is just OK). We noticed a more drunk and sleezy crowd this time and decided not to stay a 3rd night because of it. We had asked for a particular room which wasn't available. The front desk was very nice and offered to move us the next day but we chose to stay in our upstairs room which had high beamed ceilings... The breakfast closed too

Courteous and friendly receptionist. Manager and his wife very helpful and friendly. I have been coming here several years and have been very happy with my stay at the Days Inn. The room was very clean. I liked the use of the fridge and micro wave. Location was excellent, near by the Orange County Fair grounds.

Customer service reps were awesome and very helpful. Rooms were disappointing. The beds and pillows were so uncomfortable that I got very little sleep. The bedspreads were very old and even had visible signs of tears. The carpet was very worn and had tears and worn spots as well. The walls were in ill repair, where wallpaper had been torn, squares were simply glued on and not matched in with the original layer. The toilet seat was so old that there were literally cracks and dents in the seat. Not a very pleasant room at all. Although the front desk ladies were very nice, it does not make up for the rooms and I will not be staying at this Days Inn again nor would I recommend it to anyone who values a comfortable nights sleep.

Summary Heading: most undesireable place i have ever stayed in.
Summary: not worth the money you spend. all rooms are smoking and stick. not friendly or responsive staff. ask the staff for non smoking room, I was told take it  or leave it. I will never book another room through them again.

our room was average, there were a few things i think  needed a drastic change which were, the decor pillows smelled like an old man slept on them with dirty hair, and the the pillows were so old and used and flat it was hard to sleep on them.but overall i think it is a 2 star motel, the staff was very kind.

I have stayed at this place since 1997, there has been many changes in all of that time, the most recent is the granite showers and counters very nice, this place is convenient to where we go and we feel safe here ,we come to Cali 3-4 times per year and this is the one we like the most ,onetime we stayed at the extended hotel in Huntington Beach cause days inn was full! But we want to stay here !!

Negatives: I couldn't believe the amount if mold growing on the ceiling, walls, and floor. Lumpy bed and pillows.The toilet handle had to be manually lifted after each flush or it wouldn't refill the tank. Breakfast consisted of boxed sugar cereals, coffee, and packaged pastry. No fruit. No OJ (unless Sunny DLite counts). Plus: Staff was very nice. Parking was free and available.

By mistake I booked a smoking room but was told on the phone the mgr would try to change it, then told on arrival not allowed.  Parking was tight, room was shabby, cigarette burns on the tables, but didn't smell much.  In the morning the coverlet definitely smelled under my chin, ihad slight nausea and headache.  No coffee supplied with the coffee maker.   Highway noise all night.   I had booked 2 nights but didn't return for the second even though paid in advance.

Summary Heading: worst no people skills very rude
Summary: the worst place ever to reserve a room lady had no people skills the worst experience ever will never rent there again dont need to be treated like an animal by a stupid lady rude rude rude

I HAD A 2 NIGHT STAY WITH MY 11 YR OLD SON. first thing, they put me in a single bed room , they could not move me due to no vacancy , that was ok.but the front desk clerk has no manners and is rude and never smiles or friendly.inside the room, the microwave has ducktape around the  cord , there was a huge hole in the wall on the side of the fridge, the breakfast is barely anything but cereal and cakes . no parking spaces so the car was in a non parking space all night risking getting towed.just a terrible situation for me, swear to never go there again. Travel Lodge was way more suitable, I left the hotel the early a.m even had t owait for my 25.00 security hold and wait for someone to show up at the front desk for atleast 6 min. no one was there . how dumb.there u cant leave

Served ita purpose at price.  I wouldo not want to bring my kid here again.  The comforters and decorative pillows seemed old and they had holes in them which also made me question how clean they were.  One of the two blankets had holes in it too.  Pillows were not standard queen size.  On plus side bathroom appeared clean. Microwave,  fridge, and coffeemaker all worked.
Thank you ! I was pleased with the quality of this hotel and the friendly gesture of the staff.

Stayed here using my Wyndham Points for a Wedding nearby.  The good points, it was accessible to the 405 and 55 Freeway, the bathroom was clean, shower had good pressure and plenty of hot water, fresh towels daily.  Bad Points, security was less than desirable.  No security latch on door, just the deadbolt.  Stranger hanging around smoking in benches outside of doors.  Our room was back in a dark corner and never felt comfortable.  Each time we left, we were confronted by another guest? who asked inappropriate questions, we didn't feel necessary to answer.  The parking lot was always packed with maintenance vehicles taking up some spots. The room was extremely dark, even after putting on all the lights. Carpet felt wet, when we checked in after 3pm, they were still vacuuming and

Summary Heading: For a night this was ok. Very outdated and old and because...
Summary: For a night this was ok. Very outdated and old and because if that it brought the quality down. Bed and pillow wasn't very comfortable.
Place looks great  since the renovations. I especially like the granite counters in the bathroom and the new tubs and showerheads

The hotel is next to Freeway 55 and is easy to get to. My kids looked forward to going swimming but the pool was yucky with green stuff in it. Obvious hadn't worked in some time. There is no hot tub so the kids were disappointed.  The bed was ok and a little bouncy but the AC was noisy and after 2 days it finally cooled off the room running.on high.  We had prepaid for 2 nights. People next to our room smoked in their room and the odor carried over to our room which left a smell in our room. Breakfast was small boxed cereal, prepackaged danish, and sonny d or small apple juice cartons. The danish were good. They had no waffles, which all other Daysinn I've stayed at have had. There have no internet computer or business room. Parking is limited-not enough spaces for the rooms

Summary Heading: Average place, good for a quick stop
Summary: Average place, good for a quick stop. I had a good time here, pool is small but the beach is right down the street. Great location, alot of good food in walking distance. The mall is down the street, alot of kids attractions.
Floor was disgustingly dirty, turned, socks/feet black! Soda machines out of order. Breakfast a joke

Summary Heading: The worst Days Inn I've been to
Summary: Was going to stay for three night it was filthy and outdated.  The room was nonsmoking and reeked of smoke.  The toilet seat was broke.  I had my daughter stay with friends because it was raunchy.  Flor who greet us was rude and need to be retrained in customer service.  I checked out after one night

This establishment has become a staple in my hotel notebook. The check in process is easy, quick and most important they are pleasant and great you with a smile. The rooms are clean, the pool is always crystal clear and they always offer plenty of towels at the front desk upon request

I stayed here one night for a local class held in Newport Beach.  It's an average motel, so don't expect anything grandeur and please don't even attempt  to compare it to a Holiday Inn because its not a hotel, its a motel as in Motel 6.  The location is great, close to 55 Fwy, local shops and restaurants.  The bathrooms and counter tops for the microwave / coffee pot area are updated with a nice faux marble. My bathroom, eating and desk areas appeared to be clean. There's a nice flat screen TV and free WiFi.  The lighting is not so well, very dim and I needed to turn on all lights in the room just to have sufficient lighting for reading.  The bed was comfortable and sheets smelled and looked fresh; HOWEVER! the comforter and pillow shams on the bed were absolutely HIDEOUS. Very

We realize the was a budget motel for 1 night and weren't expecting a lot but a couple of things could have made the stay better.  As soon as we got there we felt unseen bugs crawling on us and biting us.  Probably dust mites which I know are everywhere but this was bad.  Another issue was the carpet.  Although it was vacuumed it was very dirty.  When my wife walked on it in bare feet after showering, the bottoms of her feet were very dirty.  I think fumigating and getting rid of the carpet will make the place better. For the price I didn't expect luxury but did expect cleanliness.

Summary Heading: Large rooms, dirty carpet, poor breakfast and area.
Summary: Stayed here as it was priced ok. Had three rooms. Beds were lumpy, sheets did not fit well and many had patchwork done to repair cuts and holes. Carpet needs to be cleaned as after you shower and walk to the bed your feet were black ( shampoo the carpets ). If these rooms were updated I don't see it. Pool area is small. A/C units under counter back of room and you have to get down on all fours to reach it. Outdated units, don't cool well.

This Days Inn is clean and just a short drive to the water in Newport Beach.  Small selection breakfast offered every morning.  The only real trouble is the free Wifi that is advertised does not work in the rooms.  Low priced, great location for surfers and tourists visiting the Newport Beach Area.

According to their website they just completed renovation 3 days before our arrival. We've stayed in many hotels across California but this was by far the worst that we have experienced. Didn't have our booking in Non smoking room!! the mattress was a junk, you can feel the metal coils just by touching it without applying any pressure not to mentioned you can just sunk in the middle. We also asked for roll a way bed for our son and it was worst than our bed, the metal coils were almost visible!! we had to ask for view more blankets for padding. the carpet is black/dark color.. when we walked bare foot on it, our feet turned dirty and black and we were forced to wear our sandals in the room. The complementary breakfast was just a joke.. they had charged our credit card 3 times!!

Summary Heading: overall the staff was great. they solved any problems that...
Summary: overall the staff was great. they solved any problems that came up.  breakfast could have had some fresh fruit. Location was perfect.  Would stay here again.

Clean rooms and the staff are friendly.  Rooms are being updated and looking good.  Quite area and very handy location. Close to just about everything in the LA OC area and just minuets from the beach.  Nice pool. Rooms have refrigerator and microwave, and free wifi.

The rooms looked like something you'd rent by the hour, and were in horrible disarray. There was construction going on ( which I was not notified about during booking) and although they said they only did it certain hours, I didn't have any water to shower with 3 hours after they said they should have been done. The receptionist was rude during check in, and when we reported problems with the room.
Given the state of the bathroom the place is LONG overdue for upgrades. The carpet felt that someone tried to clean it and it never dried out

Summary Heading: Let me clarify that my 2 for the rooms is strictly because...
Summary: Let me clarify that my 2 for the rooms is strictly because they haven't been redone in A LOT of years, but they are just beginning this process.  The staff was fantastic, the room was clean, and I spent well under $100 a night in Orange County on marathon weekend.  I was more than pleased.
The staff were all very kind. The room itself was outdated and extremely worn out. Chipped paint, caulk peeled back in the bathroom, and the blankets felt a little strange.

Summary Heading: Room was good quality and beds were comfortable.  For the...
Summary: Room was good quality and beds were comfortable.  For the price the area was good and the beds were comfortable.  For our purpose of just a place to sleep this place fit the bill excellent.

Summary Heading: Low Budget At A Sad Location
Summary: This is an older two-storey motel located on the northbound access road of Newport Blvd between 21st and 22nd St. If you're not using a GPS you might bypass it and have to figure how to double back. It's really no problem, just know it's on a 1-way street, so once passed you have to cross over the freeway to get back. I had an upgraded room which means they added a fridge and microwave to the furnishings and gave me a king bed. The air cooler/heater was under the sink countertop so I had to crawl under it to manage the settings. Though you might never need an air conditioner here, some cooler mornings might require a heater. You're about 2.5 miles from the beach here so there's strong evidence of past mildew problems in addition to the tub faucet having a continual slow drip.

Summary Heading: The people are very nice but our stay there was not so...
Summary: The people are very nice but our stay there was not so good. Our first night there we were or should I say my husband was confronted by a prostitute.. right at our door.. she was obviously staying in the room over us and proceeded to stomp back and forth across our ceiling all night long. As for the room, it was a good size and clean although there was some black residue all over the corner of the bathroom sink. Not sure what it was..but I kept wiping it up and it kept coming back ...Again though the people working there were very nice and it seems like they are trying to make it better..

The bathroom was a pit.  In addition, the shower did not work correctly until someone worked on it.  We did not expect the outside entry to the rooms (prefer inside entry).  The breakfast was as poor as I have seen.  Even if you like cereal there was  only ONE that was NOT a sugared brand and it was always out. They fixed the problem with a new window quickly but I don't understand how that happens or goes in noticed by house keeping. Then we go to take showers and the bathtub is peeling and dirty. The bed had a huge indention in it so I couldn't get comfortable. If that wasn't enough there are crickets or 1 cricket INSIDE the room that kept me up almost all night. It was horrible. We stayed here because of the proximity to a close friend. The  front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. the room was clean but obviously "tired" and had some deferred maintainence like missing bathroom trim, stains, worn carpet. But the bed was comfortable. There was a pool but we didn't use it. And the location is not too far of a drive to Newport and Huntington beach.

for location and value its good that's it, the sheets on the bed were too short about 1 foot at the end of bed mattress was showing.  the breakfast was package doughnuts, coffee I think was instant, and package oatmeal. that's it.

I booked my room online. When I got to the location, I found out that I had been given a smoking room, even though I had not been aware of that when booking. There was no option to switch, and the room reeked of stale smoke, and there were burn holes all over the comforter. I hope to never stay here again.
I will say this motel needs some major upgrades!  The shower was painted over with white paint and was peeling, and the room wave very gloomy and needed to be brightened up.
Very clean place and very very friendly staff but the guests in the room above us which I believe was 119 were very noisy and I believe they had a dog in the room

Summary Heading: This Days Inn was an ok place to stay when you're not in...
Summary: This Days Inn was an ok place to stay when you're not in the room except to sleep. The throw latch on the door was broken. The bathtub was not in the best condition.

Room was ok. About what I would expect for the money.  Pros: Price was right. Location, was close to a lot of places we wanted to go. Fairly quiet.  Cons:There were things that were very worn looking and some repairs that needed to be made. The bathroom fan didn't work, the counter just outside the bathroom was loose and I was afraid it would fall off. The TV was set up so it cut off a bit of the picture on all sides. And the breakfast was not at all what was expected. Don't count on it being anything that would fill you up. There was no place to sit and eat. Everything was cheap, prepackaged food. They did have cereal boxes and quality juice boxes, but everything else was not what I was expecting.

Summary Heading: The service was wonderful. The outside of the hotel was...
Summary: The service was wonderful. The outside of the hotel was very clean. The maid service wad great too and made sure we had plenty of items when asked. My only complaint really is the bed comforter and decorative pillows were absolutely disgusting. They were old and ripped. Definitely needs to be updated. I was actually afraid to touch them, let alone sleep on them. So my husband and I just used the white sheet.  The hotel rooms could use a lot of updating, but was still good for the price. I would stay again...hopefully they udate their bedding though.

no internet  reclainer in very bad conditions  bathroom in very bad conditions too the key no working the parking lot not safe in the night somebody traying to open my truck and damage my truck when is no open

We got a non smoking room with the walls all thrashed and really smelled like smoke. We tried calling customer service at around the time we made it to our room and there was nobody that could help us. We called the front desk and all the lady told us was "well do you want the room? Yes or no?"  Wouldn't recommend anybody staying there. This was at the Costa Mesa-Newport Beach Days Inn.

Went to checkin at about 430pm. Computers were down. They told me they would call when I could check in. They never did. Said they probably had the wrong phone number. There were 3 different rooms in our party. All gave them different phone numbers. They didn't call any of us. Because we planned to drink we left our cars and had to take a cab back. It would have been nice to be notified when we could have checked in.

Called the front desk on the after noon before check out to ask if we could stay another night. Was told yes but the rate would be slightly higher, ok with us but needed to stop in at front desk in the morning. The next morning on our way to a wedding we stopped at the front desk to be told that we had to move upstairs and the rate would be higher. One disabled person and one senior, upstairs very difficult for us. Very unhappy about this.
Very attractive room. Like the high ceiling. Quiet. It was in a back corner. Even though on Newport Blvd. Really didn't hear any traffic.

The staff was very nice and accomodating.  The continental breakfast was ok.  The rooms need a renovation specially the bathrooms, the tub was really bad....the beds could be more comfortable.  We only stayed one night and for the price it was fine.

Do not go there! Nasty, Dirty, Filthy. Description from Hotel.com says the rooms were just renovated. Not true! We took pictures of the aweful room. I wouldn't walk on the carpets barefooted. And didn't want to sit on the bed spread. Gross! Bath tub wasn't clean. But the worst thing of all was the BLACK MOLD all over the window! Not just a little but all along the bottom and sides! The blinds were open when we walked in and we noticed it right away. Why didn't the staff notice it?!?! Never again will we stay there! Very disappointed for a Days Inn.

Summary Heading: The room was bit smelly but other than everything in the...
Summary: The room was bit smelly but other than everything in the room was good.  Bathroom was clean but very old.  Breakfast was good but I have seen better breakfast in the other Days Inn i have stayed in.

Comforter and Shams were old, looked filthy and had holes.  Pillows were deteriorated foam. It was crumbly. Screens were torn. Bars on the window to the side. "Breakfast" was packaged singles, likely little Debbie, cereal no milk, and when coffee was gone, coffee was gone! She mentioned the coffee maker in my room, I told her I didn't have one.  She said your supposed to, but never offered to bring me one.

It was so close to the beach only 5 min away!!!! For that price it is not bad !!! =) what I liked is the top floor rooms looked like a cabin from the inside and it was huge compared to other days inn rooms. Only think I have to warn you about is its a little worn down but you will get over it fast I liked it ! =)

Summary Heading: Cheap hotel ok if not wanting luxury
Summary: Staff friendly. good room rate, discount when asked for as a walk in. very dated rooms. pool been out of action for a long time. Overall ok budget hotel. Close enough to the beach and other good tourist places. Breakfast uncluded.

The Front Desk Clerk was wonderful.  The room had a few issues.  The smoke alarm and television remotes all needed batteries.  The first night the smoke alarm beeped all night. The guests above us were noisy.

Deja, was the employee on duty during my three day stay. She was so polite and professional with all my needs...even made a hand written map to the place I wanted to go...OUTSTANDING! When I make my return trip, I will most likely stay their.

Summary Heading: Nice rooms but breakfast was vending machine selection
Summary: Room was clean, comfortable and quiet. Free breakfast was advertised but the selection was prepackaged sugar pastries, juice boxes, cereal boxes, milk and coffee. The only items we could enjoy were the oatmeal packages and oranges. We would stay here again but the free breakfast could use some improvements.

Overall the stay was good.  Upstairs people were really noisy.  Light bulb in bathroom was flickering, mentioned this to maid but nothing done about it. Room was old but clean.  Really need to replace sleeping pillows!
I rented a room with a king size bed. It had a fridge and microwave and the room was fairly large although the main light in the room didn't work and one of the outlets by the bathroom didn't work.

Summary Heading: not exactly what i was expecting
Summary: we had the two room queen.  i was disappointed when i got there mostly because of the price we paid.  it is way overpriced for the quality of the room.  if i has paid half the price, i probably would not have expected more.  pros:  quite roomy pretty quiet considering the area it was clean good shower pressure  cons: old and run down cupboards and shelves were broken or barely hanging on basic tv channels (i got the two rooms so the kids could watch disney or nick and they had neither...nothing kid friendly) rotten smell outside blew into our room through the air conditioner

Room is in desperate need of a remodel.  Room has mold and smells like smoke, even though a non-smoking room.  The whole bathroom was painted over including the sink, bathtub, and tile, so the paint is just peeling off of these surfaces.  It was pretty quiet during the duration of our stay.  Free breakfast is just cereal and packaged pastries.  Service was friendly!!

Summary Heading: after you first found your way to the Inn, it was easy to...
Summary: after you first found your way to the Inn, it was easy to get into and out of. There was a large security gate at side exit which made me feel more secure while parking.  In/Out traffic had to pass by the front desk

Mike - the hotel manager was really cool and stayed on top of getting us everything we needed for my 9 day stay at days inn.  It's not right ON the beach, but anyone with GOOGLE can find that out!  The rooms were nice, the Room service and front desk personnel were very nice and helpful, I REALLY enjoyed my stay.

Summary Heading: Worst Hotel I have ever experience!
Summary: This Hotel is the most smelly, dirty, broken down and flithy room I have ever been in.  The carpet smelled horribily, the bathroom sink doors would not stay shut.  We were on the upper floor and the floor was uneven to walk on.  This hotel should be demolished and rebuilt.  For your information, we did not feel safe or and didn't stay in this room.  I went to another hotel but, I paid for this.  I will never go into another Days Inn Hotel, after this experience.

The pics on the web are a little deceiving.  There is a small breakfast bar in the lobby which is really small but there is no seating so you have to make several trips if you have a family of 5 like me back and forth to the room.  Pool was closed for maintenance when we were there in mid-summer (July) but they did say they would open it for us if we gave them notice but we like to come and go so it never worked with our schedule.  The pool is not heated either so the temperature was cool to have the kids in the pool w/o it being heated.  The rooms are very old and needed maintenance. Won't stay there again.

room okay, forgot to tell front desk that the shower curtain rod needs to be repaired, lower screw on each end of bowed rod not holding allowing rod to bend down.  otherwise good stay Room 124. Breakfast was good.

This hotels room does not look like the picture. It smells, the carpet is dirty, beds are saggy, pillows are old and lumpy, blankets have cigarette burns and tears. Bathroom sink is cracked and doesn't drain. In the shower the paint is pealing off the tile. Asked the girl at desk if all rooms were like this and she said no. She even had to go look at the room to make sure it was ready. They wouldn't refund my money and wanted me to pay more for a suite that wasn't too much better. The manager came up to room and cussed me out for complaining to gal at desk. Call days inn 800 number and their suppose to call me back.  Don't stay here!

Summary Heading: The room is filthy and run down. I asked for a non-smoking...
Summary: The room is filthy and run down. I asked for a non-smoking room and the front desk said that it was booked through an agent (priceline) and there was nothing she could do. So I got a smoking room and it really smelt bad. I ended up forgoing the pre-paid room and staying somewhere else.

Summary Heading: It's the best hotel in its class in this area
Summary: I have stayed in a few of the hotels in this area and its without question for the money, the best hotel in the area in the under 100 range.    The rooms are very spacious with raised wooden beam ceilings.   Bathrooms actually have windows and light and are spacious  enough.   Beds are big and comfortable with more than one or two pillows.   Lastly, and importantly the staff is really nice. I would highly recommend this hotel. It's much, much better than the reviews.

Summary Heading: the bathtub looked like it had not been cleaned in...
Summary: the bathtub looked like it had not been cleaned in sometime.It looked like it had been painted over the dirt.That could not be cleaned.This is the forth time.I have stayed at days inn.and it is sure to be my last.never agian not worth the money.

I did some research before booking. The bio on hotel made it seem as if it was nice and close to the beach.  It is directly in front on the busy southern california freeway in a not so nice area of Newport Beach.  All the paint on the exterior eves were peeling off.  They have a security gate around property guess that should let you know what kind of motel it is.  After a 7 hour drive to get there we attempted to check in at 1:30 and no rooms were ready.  Check in time is 3 am they phoned me at 3:25 to tell me my room was ready.
