Summary: Good location close to the beach and most Orange County attractions.  Very competitive pricing and good value.

Summary Heading: Good location for a alow cost lodging. Rooms could use a...
Summary: Good location for a alow cost lodging. Rooms could use a good cleaning and some maintenance.  What's with the TV channel selections?

Summary Heading: The service was great. The staff very friendly.  The room...
Summary: The service was great. The staff very friendly.  The room was clean but smelled old. It could use updating. I expected to have a similar breakfast experience as when I stayed in La Habra. The office space was limited to have the same spread but maybe some fresh fruit would have been nice.  They need a new hot water pot. The water was lukewarm.

Summary Heading: Location is great, but motel needs to be updated. Windows...
Summary: Location is great, but motel needs to be updated. Windows shake and have visible mold. Mattresses are old and soft, as are pillows.

The hotel was very convenient, inexpensive and the owners or managers were visbile all of the time if there were any problems. Overall, it was very good. I will be going back there again in the future.

The people were friendly, for the most part. There was a lady, when we checked out, that was more interested in the garbage TV she was watching. Very unprofessional! The TV didn't work properly. The remote hardly worked. A light switch  on as lamp on the desk didn't work. The doors on the vanity were broken.  The swimming pool was out of serviceThe pillowes were of the poorest quality I have ever seen. I will never stay at another Days Inn. I would actually request a partial refund.

Hello, I was very unsatisfied with the quality of the room.  The blanket was full of cigarette burn holes and it looked as if there was a tear in the blanket that had been glued back together.  The bathroom was appalling and I couldn't even fathom the idea of using the shower so I had to leave without showering the next day.

Summary Heading: The Good, the Bad, and the Ugly
Summary: The Good: the motel is in a pretty good location, although a little tricky getting in and out. It's on a very noisy street, but the rooms are set back from it, so we didn't notice the noise when inside. The room was spacious, which was good because we did a lot of shopping! The staff were mostly helpful. LOTS of electrical outlets in the room (seems to be a rarity these days). The price was good. The Bad: this is an OLD motel (see The Ugly below). The TV was about 16 generations outdated and had a blown speaker. I reported this to the office with no result. There were about 10 channels that came in OK. A couple of oddities in the room: a bathroom window that opened to the outside and would have been easy for a burglar to get through (in fact, it was open when we arrived). Also,

Summary Heading: Good value for price, but you get what you pay for.  TV...
Summary: Good value for price, but you get what you pay for.  TV must be over 30 years old and had really bad color hues.  Unfortunately, the tenant upstairs walked around all night on my last night.  Unable to go back to sleep after 4:00 AM.

I had to take a very cold shower!  My husband went to the desk to complain and was told if I called they would have moved me to another room for a shower.  I am not about to pack and move for a shower after I am undressed and ready to take a shower.  My husband was told all four rooms on that water heater were out.  When did they know there was a problem and why were we not informed earlier.  A message could have been left on the phone.  Another problem, the bathroom window didn't lock.  The bedding looked very old and used.  The hotel is in need of a remodel.

Room was out-dated, poor quality of furniture, toliet ran all the time, tub was patched. Internet connection had poor reception, television had limited selection and one local channel was fuzzy. Continential breakfast had very limited selection.
Good value. Had an overnight business trip. Close to where I had to work , and the price was very reasonable. Only thing negative about the room was the shower head was too low.

I have stayed at this hotel at least 4 times now during the last 5 years (I am from Europe). This time I had a ground floor non-smoking King bed room, for seven nights.  Pros: I like the location in Orange County, directly near freeway 55. I also like that rooms have refrigerator and microwave, because I like to get take-out food (which you can have aplenty at lots of places nearby) and re-heat it if it is too much. I also like to store food and drinks in the fridge. I liked the bed and had good sleep, the hotel was also quiet. Continental breakfast is ok.  Cons: The fridge I had in my room had lost a "leg", it tilted towards you when you opened the door and you would have to lift the door up in order to close the door again.... Bathroom interior is also asking for a renovation.

I come into town on a weekly basis...and found that for the most part this location in Costa Mesa is pretty good for the buck.  With only one issue so far, I addressed it and hopefully I will not have a dirty tub again.    Very nice staff at check in and check out.  Good coffee.
The bathtub was terrible, not dirty just needs to be resurfaced. The staff was awesome and very helpful. Midge, Ronnie, and Leslie were terrific!

first booked here so my wife and i could visit in laws who live very close and we could still have a place to stay, turns out to be 'great place', now my wife and i use it as a great little get away...it's close to everything yet quite, neat, the staff is great..housekeeping always helpful...if you want a clean..neat..place to stay, with really nice staff....this is the place. if you want a nice little clean little palce that will treat you right. come here to stay

Staff is very friendly, prices are the best for the area, and very conveniently located.   Although it looks and smells like a motel, which is not very cool. Bathroom had old cabinetry and shower/tub. Sheets/comforter/towel were clean and AC was great in the room. Sketchy characters in the area...

On the highway, Its a motel with the most basic facilities. My Ac conked off twice and then had to change the room. The location is good if your work is not in the city and its a quick come and go kind of trip for longer than 1 night on a holiday I would not recommend it.

On the plus side- the staff was very kind and friendly and worked hard to keep the room clean. Also, the location had easy access to the fairgrounds, movies, restaurants, and the beach was a quick drive. However, there are negatives: the bedding in the room is old and the bedspread needs to be thrown out. The pillows were the worst I have ever experienced because of the lumps and the mattress needs to be replaced. The "deluxe" continental breakfast consisted of cereal and prepackaged sweet rolls. I would advise looking elsewhere; I know that I will.

Summary Heading: Not the best, but certainly not the worst in Costa Mesa
Summary: Older motel in a great location.  I believe the room (208) was a corner room and the decor and bathroom were old and kind of decrepit.  Think bordello red and old TV's.  It is OK for a "budget hotel", whatever that means nowadays.  Staff very nice, but kept parking their van in the handicapped spaces.  I guess when you own the place, you can get away with that.

Having had the choice between here and Ramada, I wish we went Ramada. Apon arrival we were told the only room left was the smoking room. We booked 4 months in advance, we should of had non-smoking reserved. My fiance suffers from asthma and struggled the whole 2 days. We've stayed in other smoking rooms before fine. But this one you cannot breath in and all our belongings smell of smoke. So I guess they don't care about requests. Why in 2012 do we still even have smoking rooms? I saw about 6 ppl outside smoking at one point... yet they are all in non-smoking rooms???? Yet us the healthy gym goers who book in advance are given the dodgy smelly smoke room.   We had been road tripping across USA for 2 months and never stayed in a hotel with such bad creeks. One night we could hear

Rooms are Huge- staff is OUTSTANDING :)  Manager is Cool. Rates are more than reasonable. I would definately return again.   Its been about a year - but I promised the Mgr that I'd write a review.  Thanks again.  Tony Jackson-  1st Taxi & Charter Bus Insurance

I have stayed at this Days Inn several times. I love it. It is close to the airport and close to the beach and not too far from Disneyland :) Most hotels right on the beach or near it are very expensive, but this hotel is very reasonable! It is clean, I feel safe here and the office workers are always very friendly and go out of their way to make your stay the best it can be!!

Summary Heading: I will definitly stay here again!!
Summary: The staff was soo nice and polite, helpful in every way. Made my stay very enjoyable and relaxing!

My sister and I stayed in this motel for 2 weeks whilst on holiday in California. The staff were wonderful and very helpful- particularly Midge! We didn't have a car on holiday, so the staff were very helpful when organizing taxis (find the best prices etc) and helping us with our bus routes- very good customer service!  Our room was cleaned on a daily basis and the bathroom was immaculate. I have seen some reviews on here about the bathroom being rusty, dirty etc.... our bathroom was very clean and there was no rust, dirt anywhere- we were very pleased with this   We used the pool area on a daily basis, this was lovely as it was very secluded and we could relax and enjoy the pool/sunbathe in peace. The pool was also clean  Overall, very nice place to stay for the money  Thanks

Summary Heading: We've been staying here for years
Summary: We love to visit to the Newport Beach area several times a year and for the last 11 years or so we have always stayed at this motel. The location is great, easy biking distance to the beach and Newport Pier, plus very close to the 55 or PCH.  On this trip, as all past ones, the room was clean & good sized, and there was no noise or any problems at all.    The staff has always been wonderful and extremely welcoming.  In fact, we hadn't been able to go down for almost a year and when we returned last October, we were greeted like old friends. Not sure what staff members other reviewers could have encountered, but Mike, Nargis, and Midge are warm and wonderful people. We will be back!

Summary Heading: Days Inn, Costa Mesa.... NASTY! CHEAP! GROSS! RUDE!
Summary: Nasty hotel!   Ridiculously Cheap People. Bath tub and shower was painted with latex paint and was falling off, sticking to our feet.   Gross bedding, at least 10 years old. Sink barely drained. Every noise could be heard due to the lack of insulation.  Free breakfast amounted to dry cereal, milk and shrink wrapped muffins served in lobby that was barely 20 square feet.   Oh, don't dare not check out on time......  they will remove ALL your personal affects and store in laundry room!

This was the most disgusting hotel we've ever stayed at. the bathroom was filthy, the shelves hadn't been cleaned in what looked like years. Mirrors smeared, the bath tub full of cracks and rust. The shower head was black and didn't work, ceiling vents windows sills filthy from years of dirt build up. I've seen gas stations with cleaner toilet bowls Shower curtain had mold on it. refrigerator was defrosting and full of water.Only got two small towels, when asked for more we were told there was a limit. No ice maker. Room was large in size. Bed was comfortable, office staff Very rude.

I will list the good items first.  The room was a bit larger than average. The bathroom was ok.  The room had a frig, micro, coffee maker.  Internet access (yea!!).  The bed was comfortable.  Lots of chairs.  A very good selection of Cable channels.  AC worked.  The bad.  There were a few small holes in the wall and a panel that had been cut out of the wall was very obvious the wallpaper was done badly.  The pool shut down at 7PM!  The staff that was on at 8PM was not friendly, nor were they accommodating.   This motel would have rated much lower if it had not been for the front desk clerk that was on at 4:30AM the next morning.  He greeted me with a smile and was very helpful.  And, no I will not stay there again.
